sentences.sContent: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.sCn: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.sContent: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.sCn: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.sContent: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.sCn: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.sContent: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.sCn: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.sContent: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.sCn: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.sContent: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.sCn: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

sentences.sContent: ...there is almost no hard evidence for midlife crisis other than a few small pilot studies conducted decades ago...
...they may have actually benefited from the financial crisis in the most fundamental way: longer lives...
...in 2009 the economic crisis continues to plague Michigan...
...we may be faced with a financial crisis among elderly...
...the current crisis will probably do the same...
...Global warming may or may not be the great environmental crisis of the 21st century...

synos.tran: 危机；危险期；决定性时刻

phrases.pCn: 危机管理，处理危急的办法
[心]危机干预；危机处理；危机介入

remMethod.val: cri(看作cry， 哭) ＋ sis(看作SOS， 求救信号) → 哭喊着发求救信号 → 危机

trans.tranOther: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous
